pr_title: Query all of labels once selected labels condition is absent.

timeline.message: Query all of labels once selected labels condition is absent.

timeline.bodyText: Others are HashMap, this is LinkedHashMap. Why?
timeline.author: wu-sheng

timeline.bodyText: I feel like you should just copy the old codes rather than re-implement.
timeline.author: wu-sheng

replies.bodyText: Once you have the allLabels, copying is a safer way. This re-implementation is hard to be reviewed.
replies.author: wu-sheng

replies.bodyText: Could you revert them? Is there any block there?
replies.author: wu-sheng

replies.bodyText: I used to follow copy and past strategy but found it would bring more mess more than what I expect. Unlike Es, H2 and Influxdb don't fetch all data before composing the final result object. That causes I have to tweak the current algorithm unavoidably. Future more, there are too many iterations that bring some performance concerns, I want to optimize it in the new implement.
replies.author: hanahmily

replies.bodyText: I agree with that lamda is too hard to review. I'd like to improve it with other code styles.
replies.author: hanahmily

replies.bodyText: And I also add a unit test case to help define the behavior of this function. Please review it to check if it cover the main scope.
replies.author: hanahmily

replies.bodyText: Updated, open a new thread for review if necessary.
replies.author: hanahmily

timeline.author: wu-sheng

timeline.bodyText:
According this the documents, this #newTreeSet is deprecated *

Note for Java 7 and later: this method is now unnecessary and should be treated as * deprecated. Instead, use the {@code TreeSet} constructor directly, taking advantage of the new * "diamond" syntax.
timeline.author: wu-sheng

timeline.bodyText:
I think this nested expression should be better formated manually than IDE.

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                                new LabeledValue(label, id, Optional.ofNullable(
          
          
            
                                    idMap.getOrDefault(id, new DataTable()).get(label)).orElse((long) defaultValue))))
          
          
            
                                new LabeledValue(
          
          
            
                                    label, 
          
          
            
                                    id, 
          
          
            
                                    Optional.ofNullable(idMap.getOrDefault(id, new DataTable()).get(label)).orElse((long) defaultValue)))
          
          
            
                                )
